org.ensembl.driver
Class ServerDriver

java.lang.Object
  org.ensembl.driver.ServerDriver
public class ServerDriver
extends java.lang.Object

Driver providing access to an ensembl database server. Provides a database connection pool specific to the server and a cached list of database names. Sharing instances of ServerDriver amongst EnsemblDrivers can reduce the number of connections and queries made to a database server.

Author:
Craig Melsopp
See Also:
ServerDriverFactory

Constructor Detail

ServerDriver

public ServerDriver(java.util.Properties config)
Lazy loading cache of database names. Ignores "database" parameter so we can connect to a database server without a specific database.

Parameters:

Returns:

AdaptorException

filterDatabaseNamesAndReverseSort

public java.lang.String[] filterDatabaseNamesAndReverseSort(java.lang.String filter)
                                                     throws AdaptorException
Same as _filterDatabaseNames(String)_ but returns reverse sorted array. This convenience method puts the higest versioned database name at the start of the array. e.g. String latestDB = filterDatabaseNamesAndReversSort("homo_sapiens_core.*");

Parameters:
filter - String regexp specifiying which database names , if any, should be returned.
Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
filterDatabaseNames(String)

highestVersionedDatabaseName

public java.lang.String highestVersionedDatabaseName(java.lang.String prefix)
                                              throws AdaptorException
Searches the database names in the cache for the one that begins with _prefix_ and has the highest version.

Parameters:
prefix - database name prefix.
Returns:
database name from cache beginning with _prefix_ and with the highest version, or null if none begin with _prefix_.
Throws:
AdaptorException

containsPrefix

public boolean containsPrefix(java.lang.String prefix)
                       throws AdaptorException
Determines if at least one database beginning with the _prefix_ is included in _databaseNames()_.

Parameters:
prefix - beginning of a database name.
Returns:
true if _databaseNames()_ contains a database that begins with the prefix, otherwise false.
